poem:
"Whispers of Disparity"

In the age of arena politics, with whispers of bias, 
Two women in hijabs—sentinels of faith—singled out.
They claim condemnation where no gavel fell,
Caught in a maelstrom of unspoken fables.
Yet, a defiant counter-note resounds,
Their deeds, not cloths, the ticket to tumultuous exile.
Through the kaleidoscope of voices, truth wavers,
Silhouetted against the gray canvas of justice.
